think my iq dropped just by watching this movie.

BAD don't waste your time Dumb {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['universal'], 'Producers': ['Mira Nair', 'Robyn Aronstam', 'Caroline Baron', 'Shernaz Italia', 'Caroline Kaplan', 'Freny Khodaiji', 'Jonathan Sehring'], 'Starring': ['Naseeruddin Shah', 'Lillete Dubey'], 'Studio': ['NBC Universal', 'Focus Features']} Must watch - v. Heartwarming! Highly recommend it to anyone. It's centered around a wedding and who doesn't love a good party!!! ;) Sweet movie Layer Cake (Widescreen) Daniel Craig (Actor), Kenneth Cranham (Actor), Matthew Vaughn (Director) & 0 more Rated: R Format: DVD Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Sony Pictures Home Entertainment, All Sony Pictures Titles ['Product Description', "Planning to retire and begin a new life, Mr. X (Daniel Craig, Lara Croft: Tomb Raider), a successful West End drug dealer, has been asked for one last favor: to negotiate the sale of one million hitsof Ecstasy. Unfortunately for Mr. X, the pills were stolen from a Serbian drug lord who'll cut offhis head if he sells them. And with a London crime czar (Michael Gambon, Open Range & The Insider)promising to retire him permanently if he doesn't, Mr. X may be rightfully concerned about his future. Nothing worth losing his head over.", 'Amazon.com', 'As its title suggests,', 'Layer Cake', 'is a crime thriller that cuts into several levels of its treacherous criminal underworld. The title is actually one character\'s definition of the drug-trade hierarchy, but it\'s also an apt metaphor for the separate layers of deception, death, and betrayal experienced by the film\'s unnamed protagonist, a cocaine traffic middle-man played with smooth appeal by Daniel Craig (rumored at the time of this film\'s release to be on the short list for consideration as the next James Bond). Listed in the credits only as "XXXX," the character is trapped into doing a favor for his volatile boss, only to have tables turned by his boss\'s boss (Michael Gambon) in a twisting plot involving a stolen shipment of Ecstasy, a missing girl, duplicitous dealers, murderous Serbian gangsters, and a variety of lowlifes with their own deadly agendas. As adapted by J.J. Connolly (from his own novel) and directed by Matthew Vaughan (who earned his genre chops as producer of Guy Ritchie\'s', 'Lock, Stock, and Two Smoking Barrels', 'and', 'Snatch', '),', 'Layer Cake', "improves upon those earlier British gangland hits with assured pacing, intelligent plotting, and an admirable emphasis on plot-moving dialogue over routine action. Sure, it's violent (that's to be expected) and not always involving, but it's smarter than most thrillers, and Vaughan's directorial debut has a confident style that's flashy without being flamboyant. This could be the start of an impressive career.", '--Jeff Shannon'] {'Genre': 'Thriller', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Color, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Special Edition, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Ben Davis, Kenneth Cranham, Matthew Ryan, Jason Flemyng, Dragan Micanovic, Don McCorkindale, Francis Magee, Ivan Kaye, Matthew Vaughn, Dexter Fletcher, Louis Emerick, Marcel Iures, Stephen Walters, Dimitri Andreas, Colm Meaney, Steve John Shepherd, Michael Gambon, Darren Healy, Tom Hardy, Ben Whishaw, Benjamin Davis, Daniel Craig, George HarrisBen Davis, Kenneth Cranham, Matthew Ryan, Jason Flemyng, Dragan Micanovic, Don McCorkindale, Francis Magee, Ivan Kaye, Matthew Vaughn, Dexter Fletcher, Louis Emerick, Marcel Iures, Stephen Walters, Dimitri Andreas, Colm Meaney, Steve John Shepherd, Mich… See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), French (Dolby Digital 2.0 Surround), Unqualified', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 45 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '2.40:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'R (Restricted)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 3.2 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'MFR043396108899#VG', 'Director': 'Matthew Vaughn', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Color, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Special Edition, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 45 minutes', 'Release date': 'August 23, 2005', 'Actors': 'Daniel Craig, Kenneth Cranham, Dexter Fletcher, Michael Gambon, Colm Meaney', 'Dubbed': 'French', 'Subtitles': 'English, French', 'Studio': 'Sony Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Number of discs': '1'} Dark comedy

profile:
**Updated User Summary:**

- **Rating Tendencies:** The user demonstrates a critical yet evolving perspective on content. Their recent rating of 4.0 reflects a balanced approach, indicating an appreciation for well-executed films while exhibiting a moderate stance on narratives.

- **Content Preferences:** The user enjoys emotionally resonant family-friendly films and is open to darker comedies and crime thrillers. However, their latest review raises concerns about explicit content and violence, reaffirming their preference for quality storytelling over unfiltered material. 

- **Advisories Discomfort:** Consistent avoidance of explicit content, violence, and foul language remains a priority for the user. Their enjoyment of complex themes reveals a refined taste, suggesting a willingness to engage with depth yet maintaining a preference for tastefully handled content.

- **Emotional Reaction:** While the user typically connects deeply with films, favoring uplifting narratives, their recent review categorizes a film as a "good time filler." This indicates an occasional preference for lighter, less emotionally demanding entertainment.

- **Engagement Style:** Reviews are characterized by straightforwardness and sincerity, showcasing emotional involvement. The user’s moderate rating highlights their ability to enjoy simpler narratives while still valuing complexity, showcasing a versatile viewing experience that balances depth with accessibility.
